newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU says agrees increase in Japan auto imports. [corrected 11:08 gmt]
newsitem.headline: EU says agrees increase in Japan auto imports. [corrected 11:08 gmt]

text.p: The European Commission said on Friday it had accepted an increase of 13,000 cars in Japan's allowed import quota for 1996, a European Commission spokesman told a news conference on Friday.

The European Union and Japan agreed an import quota of 1,066,000 (Corrects from 1,006,000) cars for Japan, a figure which has now been revised upwards on the basis of better-than-expected sales figures for the 15-country bloc.

"These were figures agreed in March when we were basing ourselves on a European market of 13.289 million (Corrects from 30.282 million) cars. This year the market was better than expected, we are talking about 13.545 million (Corrects from 30.545 million) units for Europe, so about 260,000 units more than agreed back in March," the spokesman added.
"So we have agreed an increase in the Japanese figure...of 13,000," the spokesman said.
